results.title: Simvastatin prolongs survival times in prion infections of the central nervous system.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ prolongs survival times in @<m>DISEASE_Prion_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017096 @@@prion infections@@@ of the central nervous system.

results.title: Docosahexaenoic and eicosapentaenoic acids increase prion formation in neuronal cells
results.text_hl: We report that treatment with @CHEMICAL_Docosahexaenoic_Acids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004281 @@@docosahexaenoic acid@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Docosahexaenoic_Acids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004281 @@@DHA@@@), @CHEMICAL_Eicosapentaenoic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015118 @@@eicosapentaenoic acid@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Eicosapentaenoic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015118 @@@EPA@@@) or the @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ synthesis inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced the amounts of free @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ in membrane extracts from @<m>DISEASE_Prion_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017096 @@@prion@@@-@DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infected@@@ neuronal cells.

citations.NLM: Bate C, Tayebi M, Diomede L, Salmona M, Williams A. Docosahexaenoic and eicosapentaenoic acids increase prion formation in neuronal cells BMC Biol. 2008 Sep 12;6():39. PMID: 18789130

results.title: Induced neuroprotection independently from PrPSc accumulation in a mouse model for prion disease treated with simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Induced neuroprotection independently from @GENE_PRNP @GENE_19122 @@@PrPSc@@@ accumulation in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model for @<m>DISEASE_Prion_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017096 @@@prion disease@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

results.title: Hybrid molecules synergistically acting against protein aggregation diseases.
results.text_hl: Here, we review the pharmaceutical strategy of generating hybrid compounds, i.e. compounds consisting of several independently acting moieties with synergistic effects, on key molecular players in @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@ and @DISEASE_Creutzfeldt_Jakob_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007562 @@@CJD@@@. For @<m>DISEASE_Prion_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017096 @@@prion diseases@@@, we review hybrid compounds consisting of two different @CHEMICAL_Heterocyclic_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006571 @@@heterocyclic compounds@@@, their synergistic effects on @<m>DISEASE_Prion_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017096 @@@prion@@@ replication in a cell culture model and their ability to prolong survival of experimentally @<m>DISEASE_Prion_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017096 @@@prion-infected@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ in vivo.

citations.NLM: Korth C, Klingenstein R, Müller-Schiffmann A. Hybrid molecules synergistically acting against protein aggregation diseases. Curr Top Med Chem. 2013;13(19):2484-90. PMID: 24059335
citations.BibTeX: @article{24059335, title={Hybrid molecules synergistically acting against protein aggregation diseases.}, author={Korth C and Klingenstein R and Müller-Schiffmann A}, journal={Curr Top Med Chem}, volume={13}, number={19}, pages={2484-90}}
